Dārukammika Sutta：A wood-seller visits the Buddha at Ñātika and tells him that，in his family，alms are given to various kinds of monks - forest-dwellers，rag-wearers，arahants，etc．

The Buddha points out to him that though it is difficult to distinguish the good and bad qualities of monks，yet he should continue to give alms to the Order．A.iii.391f.
